alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Eastern Ascension; Iberville; Northern Livingston; Pointe Coupee; Southern Livingston; St. James; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 3:01PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Ascension, northeastern St. James, southeastern West Feliciana, West Baton Rouge, southeastern Pointe Coupee, Livingston, southwestern East Feliciana, northeastern Iberville and East Baton Rouge Parishes through 345 PM CDT... At 300 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from New Roads to near Whitehall. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Denham Springs, Gonzales, Plaquemine, Port Allen, New Roads, St. Francisville, Oak Hills Place, St. Gabriel, Walker, Addis, Lutcher, Brusly, Livingston, Livonia, Sorrento, French Settlement and Maringouin. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 137 and 196. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 31. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Eastern Ascension; Iberville; Northern Livingston; Pointe Coupee; Southern Livingston; St. James; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana; Western Ascension
